pgTitle: List of museums in West Virginia

rows.text: Also known as General Adam Stephen House, located next to Triple Brick Museum
Art Museum of West Virginia University
Part of the Clay Center for the Arts & Sciences of West Virginia, science exhibits, art gallery and a planetarium
Exhibits include the mummified bodies of two female asylum inmates that were artificially preserved in 1888
Owned and operated by the Elizabeth Beauchamp Chapter Daughters of American Pioneers
Coal mine town, mine and museum, also Youth Museum of Southern WV
information, exhibits include period room displays and antique telephones
Blenko Glass Visitor Center and Museum
Includes Blennerhassett Museum of Regional History and rebuilt early 19th century Blennerhassett Mansion on the island
Industry, early education and pioneer life
information, historic coal camp company store
Regional cultural center with three fine art exhibit galleries
Includes heritage railroad, museum, train shops, recreated 1940s logging camp, model railroads
Includes the Pine Run One Room School
Central West Virginia Genealogy and History Library and Museum
website, operated by the Ceredo Historical Society
Includes Museum in the Park with changing art and history exhibits
Children's Museum of the Ohio Valley
website, operated by the Bituminous Coal Heritage Foundation, heritage of area coal fields industry
website, information, West Virginia’s coal history
Mid-19th century period home of Civil War Col. George Imboden, schoolhouse, museum of historic household and cultural artifacts
General store with antiques and historic shop items
Mid-19th century period home operated by the Colonial Dames of America in the state of West Virginia
Daughters of the American Revolution Toll House Museum
website, information, operated by the Hampshire County Public Library, 19th century log house
Includes museum with history and artifacts from the American Civil War battle fought at the site
information, scroll to listing, located in the former jail
Mid 18th century stockade fort erected by order of Col. George Washington during the French and Indian War
Reconstructed American Revolutionary War era fort
website, open by appointment, includes rare and exotic string, woodwind, brass and other instruments
Grafton B & O Railroad Heritage Center
18th-century house, includes Saunders One Room School House Museum
website, World War II memorabilia and home life
History of the Greenbrier and its presidential visitors
Includes the Delf Norona Museum with artifacts from the prehistoric mound
Includes many museums and historic sites
General Thomas M. Harris School Museum
Operated by the Ritchie County Historical Society
website, includes Museum of Progress with home displays from 1850, 1900, to 1925, transportation museum and country store museum
Operated by the Preston County Historical Society
website, operated by the Collis P. Huntington Railroad Historical Society
Includes Jackson Family Mill Museum, Blaker Grist Mill, McWhorter Cabin, Mountain State Heritage Center and Mary Conrad Cabin
website, includes toys, model trains, and a scale model of downtown Wheeling
Lost River Artisans Cooperative and Museum
website, includes furniture, tools, textiles, photographs
Includes cave tours and museum with fossils, rocks and minerals
website, also known as Those Who Served Museum
Art and culture center with two galleries
Located in Berkeley Springs State Park
Mansion Museum - 1900 mansion with decorative furnishings and local history exhibits, and the Glass Museum with Wheeling glass and china
website, local history of this Depression-era project, period displays, art
Operated by the Greenbrier Historical Society, decorative arts and local history
Oglebay Institute’s Stifel Fine Arts Center
Oil and gas industry in West Virginia and Ohio
Old Morgantown Glass Collectors' Guild Glass Museum
website, decorative glass pieces, currently rebuilding the museum
Operated by the Ritchie County Historical Society
Operated by the Ritchie County Historical Society
Operated by the Pocahontas County Historical Society

website, river life and commercial enterprise on the Ohio and Kanawha Rivers, including great floods, boat construction, sternwheel steamers, river disasters, river industry, contribution to World War II, a full scale pilot house simulator, 2400 GAL native fish aquarium and a research library
Reconstructed 1770s log fort with seasonal 18th century living history demonstrations and the 19th century Job Prickett House
Operated by the Randolph County Historical Society
1780s log-cabin style church and adjacent museum, heritage landmark of the United Methodist Church
Royce J. and Caroline B. Watts Museum
listed on the National Register of Historic Places
Owned by the Belle Historical Restoration Society, Inc., early 19th century period house and local history museum
Spruce Knob-Seneca Rocks National Recreation Area
information, local history, culture and art exhibits
Includes Civil War memorabilia and Fenton glass
website, located next to Adam Stephen House
Includes a nature center and Bowers Ridge Pioneer Farm, a restored 1830s mountain homestead working farm
website, operated by the Tyler County Heritage and Historical Society
website, operated by the Upshur County Historical Society
Veterans Museum of Mid Ohio Valley
Veterans Museum of Southern West Virginia
website, provides guided tours of the Victorian period Hess House, John List House and Hazlett-Fields House
Late 19th century homestead and farm museum
Weirton Area Museum and Cultural Center
History of statehood of West Virginia
West Virginia Museum of American Glass
website, decorative glass pieces created by area glass manufacturers, includes National Marble Museum
Heritage railroad and museum being planned
website, includes West Virginia's artistic, cultural and historic heritage

website, buildings of historical value, log cabins and tools, early farmhouse and furnishing, machinery, an operational 19th century blacksmith shop, turn-of-the-20th-century doctor's and newspaper offices
website, West Virginia history, culture, art, paleontology, archaeology and geology
website, includes Wymer's General Store Museum, art gallery and local history exhibits
website, historic coal camp company store
Youth Museum of Southern West Virginia
